title: About Me
text:
I am an Economics PhD student at George Mason University. I received my Bachelors in Economics from GMU in 2019 and my Masters in 2021. *
My research interests include political and applied microeconomics, historical political economy, growth, and institutional change. Of particular focus are periods of conflict and how individual behavior is shaped by those conditions. I am also interested in geospatial methods and applied econometrics.

title: Research
text: This is list of papers or projects I have or I am currently working on. Please reach out if you have any questions or requests and I will try my best to accommodate.

title: Research
text:
In Progress

Determinants of Revolt in Medieval Germany
Revolt was endemic in the later half of the middle ages across Europe. Following the Black Death, we can see an increase in revolutionary behavior over time. So far this paper find that poor harvests and reoccurences of plague combine to prime many areas for political unrest.
Draft Code


Public Opinion and the US Civil War
This is a sketch of an idea. Lincoln issuing the Emancipation Proclamation should shift public opinion in the north toward abolitionism rather than preservation of the Union. Currently drafting.
